executive_summary: The private music instruction industry is estimated to have steadily grown over the past five years. The COVID-19 pandemic contributed to a large drop in music class attendance, though lessons via video call software helped support the industry. Strong disposable income growth supported industry recovery as demand for learning instruments bounced back. More recently, the popularity of music instruction has supported further revenue growth, though weaker economic conditions are likely to cause growth to slow. Over the past five years, revenue is estimated to rise at a CAGR of 1.2% to $725.0 million, with growth of 1.1% forecast for 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Remote instruction becomes a lifeline for the industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic has led to an increase in remote music lessons held through platforms like Zoom. Despite initial barriers like control over sound quality, this shift has helped mitigate loss in revenue due to pandemic restrictions.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online classes broaden reach and improve convenience
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Before the pandemic, traditional private music classes relied heavily on face-to-face lessons in studios or at students' homes. Online instruction eliminates the need for travel, allowing instructors to fit in more lessons and also reach students beyond their immediate geographic locations.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increased leisure time and disposable income boost demand for music classes
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The rise in disposable income in recent years, coupled with a sudden increment in leisure time, resulted in more people taking up or reviving interest in musical instruments. This change has driven an increase in demand for private music classes by those looking to learn new skills or polish old ones.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increasing demand for online music instruction
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: There is expected to be a rise in the use of the internet for private music classes, increasing competition among music instructors over the next five years. With growing internet use, instructors choosing to provide online services will enjoy a larger market for their services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Health benefits impact on musical instruction
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Practicing music, be it playing an instrument or singing, is linked to various health benefits, leading to higher practice. Adults aged 60-85 showed cognitive improvements when they took piano lessons compared to those who didn't, suggesting a link between musical instruction and brain health.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Music instruction as part of early education
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Parents and educators are recognizing the value of music in child development, particularly language learning. As awareness grows about the developmental benefits of music for children, demand for such instruction is expected to grow.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry offer private music lessons. Operators instruct individual students and conduct lessons from their homes, at a studio or within students' homes. Teachers specialize in an instrument or musical skill that they have mastered and create individualized lessons for students. The industry includes private music lessons conducted in person and online; however, it does not include private music lessons taken for academic credit.

positive_impact_factors: high - steady Barriers To Entry Level

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Number of K-12 students

key_trends: The COVID-19 pandemic has led to a surge in remote music lessons through platforms like Zoom, helping the industry counter revenue losses. The move has enabled instructors to expand their reach and increase lesson frequency by eliminating travel needs.
An increase in disposable income and leisure time has driven a surge in demand for private music classes. More individuals now aspire to learn new musical skills or refine existing ones.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals aged between 5 and 10 years old
market_segmentation.segment_description: The youngest instructees are children in primary school. Demand in this segment is driven by parents' belief in the cognitive and social benefits of music education.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals aged between 11 and 17 years old
market_segmentation.segment_description: Adolescents make up a significant share of total lessons. This market segment includes adolescents aged 11 to 17, who are furthering their education and skill set.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals aged between 18 and 24 years old
market_segmentation.segment_description: Demand from young adults aged 18 to 24 has risen. This segment includes young adults, often who are seeking to improve their skills or major in music in college.

Older adults are a small but generally wealthy market for instructors. The older adult market in the private music lessons industry refers to individuals aged over 45 who engage in music education through private tuition.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals aged between 25 and 44 years old
market_segmentation.segment_description: Working age adults' disposable incomes help support their music hobbies.

products_and_services.product_description: Guitar lessons are the largest single category of music instruction.
Vocal lessons are the second largest segment of the industry.

tier_1_suppliers: Musical Instrument & Supplies Stores in the US
Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: As the percentage of business conducted online rises, individuals are likely to perform other activities online.

business_locations.location_description: The Plains region has the highest percentage (40%) of establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic region has 20% of establishments.
The Great Lakes region has 30% of establishments and 0% population.
The Southeast region has 10% of establishments and 20% of the population.
The Southwest region has 0% of establishments and the highest percentage (40%) of population.
The West region has 10% of the population and 0% of establishments.

basis_points.basis_description: Competition to private music classes is relatively limited.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: OTHER COSTS, WHICH INCLUDE THE COST OF INSTRUMENTS, PRINTED MUSIC AND ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS, ARE RELATIVELY HIGH

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Changes in the overall number of school-age children can influence the demand for music classes.
The number of instructors available for any given instrument is typically limited.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Guitar Lessons Remain the Most Popular Kind of Music Instruction
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Guitar lessons are the largest single category of music instruction.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Vocal Lessons are the Second-Most Popular Kind of Music Lesson
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Vocal lessons are the second largest segment of the industry.

FAQs.question: What is the document about?
FAQs.answer: The document contains industry data tables with information such as revenue, employment, exports, and other economic indicators for a particular industry over the years 2011 to 2022.
